ISSUE.TITLE: Issue when changing a password for a customer without a password in admin area (after upgrade from 3.80)
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Reproduce step is. 1. Site should be 3.80 2. Create some customer without password. 3. Upgrade you site to 3.90 4. Edit those customer who having null password entry in CustomerPassword Table. 5. Try to change password you will get error. Because you didn't handle null condition in below line. return customerPassword.Password.Equals(savedPassword); On PasswordsMatch method. We did below change for solution: if(customerPassword.Password == null) return false; return customerPassword.Password.Equals(savedPassword); Source: https://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/48354/error-object-reference-not-set-to-an-instance-of-an-object-change-customer-password-from-admin-side.aspx

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: #2497 Further changess on external authentions for ASP.NET Core 2.0

COMMIT.MESSAGE: #2501 Added null validation to "PasswordsMatch" method. Issue when changing a password for a customer without a password in admin area (after upgrade from 3.80)
